thread.title: Another merger ahead for Southwest Airlines?
thread.title_full: Another merger ahead for Southwest Airlines?

author: Lewis Lazare
title: Another merger ahead for Southwest Airlines?
text:
Jason Janik Gary Kelly is CEO of Southwest Airlines. In the wake of Southwest Airlines completing its merger with AirTran, speculation has surfaced that CEO Gary Kelly could be contemplating another merger in the not too distant future. According to sources, the three most likely merger targets are Alaska Airlines , Hawaiian Airlines and JetBlue . "Many of us are just sitting back waiting to see if it will be Hawaiian, Alaska or JetBlue," noted one source. Southwest (NYSE: LUV) wrapped up its protracted, four-year-long merger with AirTran late last year. So the deck is now clear, theoretically, for Kelly to do another merger deal. 
Want Denver Travel   Home of the Day
